title: Synthetic Recap
body:
EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. (AP) — The final buzzer sounded on a 95-84 victory for the New Jersey Nets, but the scoreboard told only half the story. The other half was written in the singular, breathtaking performance of San Antonio’s David Robinson, who authored a statistical masterpiece in a losing effort.

In a display of sheer, unadulterated dominance, "The Admiral" commanded the floor, pouring in a game-high 34 points. But his scoring was merely the opening act. Robinson completed a Herculean triple-double, hauling in 10 rebounds and orchestrating the defense with a staggering 10 blocked shots, turning the paint into a no-fly zone for the Nets.

While New Jersey’s Kendall Gill provided a spark with 21 points and Sam Cassell managed 17, their efforts were supporting roles in the Robinson showcase. The Nets' path to victory was paved by a balanced, grinding attack and an ability to withstand the tidal wave of Robinson’s influence. They shared the scoring load, with Jayson Williams pulling down 12 rebounds to help secure the win.

But this night will not be remembered for the final score. It will be remembered for the sight of a 7-foot-1 center patrolling the lane, rejecting shots with impunity, and filling every column of the stat sheet. On a night where his team fell short, David Robinson delivered a performance for the ages, a reminder of his unique place among the game's giants, even in the quiet agony of defeat.
